## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 60501867.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand]
 --read strand info for 1958 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1979 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 4717 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2829 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1979 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1888 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --867 type 2 SNPs
 --45 type 3 SNPs
 --912 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --1020 type 2 SNPs
 --47 type 3 SNPs
 --1067 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1980 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1887 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 434 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 20 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 100 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.996

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1531679379.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1140560127.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 811 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 1490 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2061 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 7 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 92 individuals
 --read 3557 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1715 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2061 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1842 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]

[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 2062 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1841 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 405367828.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 764 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand]
 --read strand info for 2887 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2813 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 16 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 431 individuals
 --read 7140 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 4499 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2813 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2641 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1808100480.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr21.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr21.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 804 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read strand info for 2283 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2194 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 12 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 5075 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2974 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2194 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2101 SNPs with data in multiple panels

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1013111881.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand]
 --read strand info for 2578 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2485 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 14 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 22 individuals
 --read 2582 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 592 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2485 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1990 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 2486 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1989 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz -int 31009658 31009658 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 1436 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand]
 --read strand info for 13 SNPs in the analysis region

 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 31 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --flipped strand at 0 out of 0 SNPs

 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 433 individuals
 --read 9595 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 9563 SNPs

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 31 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 32 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1550378291.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/input.gen.gz -int 107170044 107170044 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0061/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --flipped strand at 0 out of 7 SNPs

 --no SNPs removed

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1590965101.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz -int 76898266 76898266 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 598 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand]
 --read strand info for 2306 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1380 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 433 individuals
 --read 4209 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2901 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1380 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1308 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --753 type 2 SNPs
 --33 type 3 SNPs
 --786 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --554 type 2 SNPs
 --40 type 3 SNPs
 --594 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1381 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1307 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 433 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 20 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [76898266,76898266]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 100 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.996

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

The seed for the random number generator is 688247962.

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/output_info_by_sample

                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0092/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 116691685.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz -int 41362974 41362974 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 618 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand]
 --read strand info for 2038 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1931 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 7 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 4906 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3090 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1931 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1816 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 141851876.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz -int 40879922 40879922 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 571 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand]
 --read strand info for 1704 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1623 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 8 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 3908 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2415 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1623 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1493 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1321415258.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz -int 314890 314890 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr11.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr11.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0124/output_warnings

 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0
