## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1651668573.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz -int 71940748 71940748 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr12.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr12.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 732 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr12.strand]
 --read strand info for 1666 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1903 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 91 individuals
 --read 2870 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1271 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1903 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1599 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 885860429.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/input.gen.gz -int 56770167 56770167 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 690 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 2288 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1996 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 18 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0163/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 119 individuals
 --read 3283 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1566 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1996 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1717 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1997 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1716 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 119 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 20 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [56770167,56770167]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1460823359.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz -int 75419740 75419740 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 233 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read strand info for 1370 SNPs in the analysis region

 --read 1010 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --flipped strand at 0 out of 0 SNPs

 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 92 individuals
 --read 1700 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --removed 853 SNPs

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance

  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0

  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1751798763.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz -int 147553909 147553909 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 797 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand]
 --read strand info for 1945 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2143 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 14 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 4988 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2923 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2143 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2065 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 2144 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 2064 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------

        reference diplotypes: 434 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 20 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [147553909,147553909]
                      buffer: 250 kb

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/input.gen.gz -int 168115283 168115283 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 449 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand]
 --read strand info for 2261 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1798 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 11 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0212/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 92 individuals
 --read 2722 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1307 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1798 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1415 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 447943612.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz -int 241626867 241626867 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 392 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand]
 --read strand info for 1878 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2353 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 431 individuals
 --read 5311 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3075 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2353 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2236 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2086232437.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz -int 188873632 188873632 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand]
 --read strand info for 3282 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 2511 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 20 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 432 individuals
 --read 6097 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3696 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2511 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2401 SNPs with data in multiple panels

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0284/reference.gen.gz

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1830430682.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/input.gen.gz -int 54338897 54338897 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0286/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 567018845.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz -int 37392204 37392204 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 1728 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1574 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 3 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 224 individuals
 --read 3167 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1782 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1574 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1385 SNPs with data in multiple panels

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance

  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1659284181.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/input.gen.gz -int 80405572 80405572 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr13.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr13.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 583 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr13.strand]
 --read strand info for 1846 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1302 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 3 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0341/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 429 individuals
 --read 3726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2495 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1302 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1231 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 916373928.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/input.gen.gz -int 20523200 20523200 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0370nd/output_warnings

diploid sampling success rate: 0.991

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 905710565.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/input.gen.gz -int 58154902 58154902 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 224 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand]
 --read strand info for 1465 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 902 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0371/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 225 individuals
 --read 2183 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1416 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 902 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 767 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 903 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 766 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 508547443.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/input.gen.gz -int 22037697 22037697 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr19_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr19.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr19.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr19_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr19_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 402 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr19.strand]
 --read strand info for 1594 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 20 individuals
 --read 1711 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 0 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0379/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 5993 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 4363 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1711 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1630 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs

 --443 type 2 SNPs
 --33 type 3 SNPs
 --476 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region

 --1186 type 2 SNPs

 --1235 total SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1712 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1629 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 434 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 20 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [22037697,22037697]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 100 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.996

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1279168357.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz -int 48921073 48921073 -k_hap 100 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/ALL_100/HsInv0486/output_warnings

 Imputation accuracy assessment
